description: Recalibrate base qualities in a BAM file (University of Michigan).

--log.description: Log and summary statistics (default: [outfile].log, or stderr if --out starts with '-').

--noeof.description: Do not expect an EOF block on a bam file.

--minBaseQual.description: Minimum base quality of bases to recalibrate (default: 5).

--fitModel.description: Check if the logistic regression model fits the data overriden by fast, but automatically applied by useLogReg.

--fast.description: use a compact representation that only allows:|* at most 256 Read Groups|* maximum quality 63|* at most 127 cycles|overrides fitModel, but is overridden by useLogReg uses up to about 2.25G more memory than running without --fast.

--keepPrevDbsnp.description: Do not exclude entries where the previous base is in dbsnp when building the recalibration table. By default they are excluded from the table.

--keepPrevNonAdjacent.description: Do not exclude entries where the previous base is not adjacent (not a Cigar M/X/=) when building the recalibration table.  By default they are excluded from the table (except the first cycle).

--useLogReg.description: Use logistic regression calculated quality for the new quality automatically applies fitModel and overrides fast.

--qualField.description: Tag to get the starting base quality (default is to get it from the Quality field).

--storeQualTag.description: Tag to store the previous quality into.

default.description: Default instance requires the users input for all files.
